item.title: Palindrome Number
item.description: Determine whether an integer is a palindrome. An integer is a palindrome when it reads the same backward as forward. Example 1: Input: 121 Output: true Example 2: Input: -121 Output: false Explanation: From left to right, it reads -121. From right to left, it becomes 121-. Therefore it is not a palindrome. Example 3: Input: 10 Output: false Explanation: Reads 01 from right to left. Therefore it is not a palindrome.
